detaileddescription.para: Channel mask value used for AVCodecContext.request_channel_layout to indicate that the user requests the channel order of the decoder output to be the native codec channel order.
Return a channel layout id that matches name, or 0 if no match is found.

Starting from the next major bump the trailing character 'c' to specify a number of channels will be required, while a channel layout mask could also be specified as a decimal number (if and only if not followed by "c"). Example: "stereo+FC" = "2c+FC" = "2c+1c" = "0x7"

memberdef.argsstring: (char *buf, int buf_size, int nb_channels, uint64_t channel_layout)
memberdef.name: av_get_channel_layout_string

detaileddescription.para: Return a description of a channel layout. If nb_channels is <= 0, it is guessed from the channel_layout.

parameterdescription.para: put here the string containing the channel layout
size in bytes of the buffer

detaileddescription.para: Append a description of a channel layout to a bprint buffer.
Return the number of channels in the channel layout.
Return default channel layout for a given number of channels.
Get the index of a channel in channel_layout.

parameterdescription.para: a channel layout describing exactly one channel which must be present in channel_layout.

simplesect.para: index of channel in channel_layout on success, a negative AVERROR on error.

detaileddescription.para: Get the channel with the given index in channel_layout.
Get the name of a given channel.

simplesect.para: channel name on success, NULL on error.

detaileddescription.para: Get the description of a given channel.

parameterdescription.para: a channel layout with a single channel

simplesect.para: channel description on success, NULL on error

detaileddescription.para: Get the value and name of a standard channel layout.

parameterdescription.para: index in an internal list, starting at 0

simplesect.para: 0 if the layout exists, <0 if index is beyond the limits
